actions: Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi, reduces swelling and generates flesh topically.
With Mo Yao, for chronic, ulcerated and non-healing sores.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, alleviates pain,d reduces swelling, generates flesh and promotes healing.
With Ru Xiang, topically as a powder for skin lesions and ulcerations.
Restrains, holds in and stops bleeding, resolves Dampness and promotes healing.
Relieves toxicity and kills parasites topically.
With Peng Sha, for ulcerations of the mouth, tongue and throat.
Relieves toxicity, reduces swelling and prevents putrefication.
Clears Heat, alleviates pain, dissipates nodules and alleviates itching.
Reduces swelling from sores and abscesses

symptoms: Symptoms are worse in Cold weather

notes: Spread petroleum jelly on a piece of gauze and cover with the above powdered herbs and apply to perforated lesions. Change the dressing once a day.
